But Mr. Brunner expected
en_second_half: me to be as good as everybody else, despite the fact that I have dyslexia and attention deficit disorder and I had never made above a C- in my life. No-he didn’t expect me to be as good; he expected me to be better. And I just couldn’t learn all those names and facts, much less spell them correctly.

en_results_raw: us to be able to do this every day, not just on tournament days, and he was not above giving us pop quizzes on the material, which made us all a little nervous. He was a bit of an oddball, but we liked him anyway, and we worked hard to make him proud. I remember one time, I spent an entire weekend studying for a test on ancient civilizations, and I was determined to get every single question right. I pored over my notes and textbooks, making flashcards and quizzing myself until I could recite the names of every Roman emperor in chronological order. When the test day arrived, I felt confident, but Mr. Brunner had a few tricks up his sleeve. He asked us questions that weren't even in the textbook, and I was stumped. But I didn't give up. I used all the knowledge I had gained to make educated guesses, and when the results were in, I was thrilled to discover that I had gotten an A+. Mr. Brunner beamed with pride, and I felt like I was on top of the world. It was moments like those that made all the hard work worth it, and I knew that I would always cherish the memories of my time in Mr. Brunner's class.

en_first_half: Mrs. Dodds was a sand castle in a power fan. She exploded into yellow powder, vaporized on the spot, leaving nothing but the smell
en_second_half: of sulfur and a dying screech and a chill of evil in the air, as if those two glowing red eyes were still watching me.
en_results: of salt and the faintest hint of coconut sunscreen in her wake. The children, who had been building an intricate moat around
en_results_raw: of salt and the faintest hint of coconut sunscreen in her wake. The children, who had been building an intricate moat around her, stared in confusion at the empty space where she once stood, their buckets and shovels frozen in mid-air. The sound of the power fan still whirred in the background, a stark contrast to the sudden stillness that had fallen over the beach. As the reality of the situation set in, the children's faces contorted in a mix of shock, confusion, and eventually, tears. Their summer vacation had just taken a dramatic turn, one that would be etched in their memories forever. The smell of salt and coconut sunscreen lingered, a bittersweet reminder of the transience of life and the unpredictable nature of the universe.

Gabe el Apestoso, como lo llamábamos, era un chico grande y desgarbado, con un cabello grasiento y una nariz que siempre parecía estar goteando. Yo, por otro lado, era la oveja negra de la familia, siempre metiéndome en problemas en la escuela y trayendo a casa amigos que mamá no aprobaba. A pesar de todo, mamá siempre estaba allí para nosotros, trabajando duro para darnos de comer y un techo bajo el que vivir, y aunque a veces la hacíamos enojar, sabíamos que nos amaba con todo su corazón.

en_first_half: Outside, nothing but rain and darkness-the kind of empty countryside you get way out on the tip of Long Island. I thought about Mrs. Dodds and the moment
en_second_half: when she’d changed into the thing with pointed teeth and leathery wings. My limbs went numb from delayed shock. She really hadn’t been human. She’d meant to kill me.
en_results: when she'd almost caught me in the kitchen, and how I'd managed to talk my way out of it. I wondered if she'd be waiting for me when I got back to the house, and what
en_results_raw: when she'd almost caught me in the kitchen, and how I'd managed to talk my way out of it. I wondered if she'd be waiting for me when I got back to the house, and what she'd do if she found out I'd been sneaking out. The thought sent a shiver down my spine as I walked, the rain seeping into my bones and weighing me down. I quickened my pace, my eyes scanning the deserted road for any sign of life, but there was nothing. Just the sound of raindrops hitting the pavement and the occasional flash of lightning illuminating the dark sky. I felt like I was the only person left in the world, and it was a lonely, unsettling feeling. Suddenly, I heard a faint noise behind me and spun around, but there was nothing there. I took a deep breath and kept walking, my heart pounding in my chest. Where was I going, anyway? I didn't know, but I knew I had to keep moving.

es_results_raw: de Haviland, que había muerto hacía ya varios años, y en cómo había sido enterrada en el cementerio de East Hampton, en una tumba sin nombre, con solo una cruz de madera para marcar su lugar de descanso. Me pregunté si alguien se acordaría de ella, o si su memoria se había desvanecido como la niebla que se levantaba del mar en las mañanas grises de otoño. La lluvia arreciaba, golpeando contra el parabrisas del coche, y yo me sentí solo y perdido en ese paisaje desolado, con solo mis pensamientos para compañía.

tr_second_half: sivri dişli, deri kanatlı o şeye dönüştüğü anı düşündüm. Yaşadığım korku yine bacaklarımı uyuşturmuştu. Gerçekte insan değildi. Beni öldürmek istemişti.

Otelin lobisinde, resepsiyondaki görevli, ona bir mesaj bıraktığını söyledi. Bayan Dodds'un, Long Island'da bir akrabasının hasta olduğu ve acil olarak oraya gitmesi gerektiği yazılıydı mesajda. Otele dönerken, yağmurun sesi arabada daha da güçlü geliyordu ve o, arabayı park ederken, yağmur damlalarının camda oluşturduğu filmi izledi. Otele girerken, lobideki görevli, ona bir barda bekleyen bir adamın olduğunu söyledi. Adam, Bayan Dodds'u aradığını ve onunla görüşmek istediğini söylemişti. O, barda bekleyen adama baktı ve tanımadığı bir yüz gördü.

I remembered the words of the prophecy, and how it had mentioned a great war between the gods, and I couldn't help but wonder if my mother's death was somehow connected to it. I turned to Chiron, my eyes locked on his, and asked him the question that had been burning in my mind since he had first mentioned her name. "Chiron, what really happened to my mother?" I asked, my voice barely above a whisper. Chiron's expression turned somber, and he hesitated for a moment before speaking. "Your mother, Sally Jackson, was a remarkable woman, Percy," he began, his voice low and serious. "She was a mortal, but she had a special gift, one that made her very important to the gods." He paused, collecting his thoughts before continuing. "She was a demigod, just like you, and she played a crucial role in the events that led up to the war." I felt a surge of excitement mixed with fear as I listened to Chiron's words, and I knew that I had to hear more.

en_results_raw: personal items, no family heirlooms to display. I took a deep breath, trying to shake off the feeling of unease that had been growing inside me since I'd arrived. The fluorescent lights overhead seemed to hum in sync with my racing thoughts, as I wondered what the future held, and whether I'd be able to make a life for myself in this unfamiliar place. I glanced around the room, taking in the rows of identical, cramped spaces, each one a tiny island of solitude in a sea of strangers. It was a far cry from the comfort and security of my old life, but I knew I had to make the best of it. I took a tentative step forward, my eyes scanning the space for any sign of hope, any glimmer of possibility. And then, I saw it - a small, forgotten corner, tucked away between the wall and the edge of the floor. It was a tiny patch of blank canvas, waiting to be filled with the colors of my new life.

The water was icy cold, and it slapped me in the face, shocking me out of my trance. I gasped, and as I did, I felt Clarisse's grip on my hair tighten once more. But it was too late, I had already broken free, and I was tumbling backward, the water carrying me with it, down into the darkness of the drain. I felt myself being pulled, sucked down, down, down, the water rushing past me, a deafening roar in my ears. And then, just as suddenly as it had started, everything was silent. I was lying on a cold, damp surface, my head throbbing, my body aching. I slowly sat up, looking around, trying to get my bearings. I was in a narrow, dimly lit tunnel, the walls made of old, cracked brick. The air was musty and dank, and I could hear the sound of dripping water echoing off the walls. I struggled to my feet, my mind racing, trying to remember how I had gotten there. And then, I heard a faint whisper, a soft, raspy voice, calling out to me. "Welcome to the underworld," it said. "You'll be staying here for a while."

The sign above the stand read 'Campfire Delights' and the smell of sizzling burgers and hot dogs filled the air. My stomach growled even louder as I waited in line, and when it was finally my turn to order, I asked for one of everything. The vendor, a friendly-looking woman with a warm smile, laughed and handed me a massive plate piled high with food. I took a bite of the burger and my eyes widened in surprise - it was the best thing I'd tasted in weeks. Just as I was about to take another bite, I heard Annabeth's voice behind me. "Hey, I see you found the food," she said, a hint of amusement in her tone. I turned to her, mouth full, and she chuckled. "I take it it's good?" she asked, and I nodded enthusiastically, still chewing.

en_second_half: too long. Luke tried his best to fix me up, but he agreed that none of the practice blades seemed to work for me.
en_results: the balance was off, throwing me completely out of sync with the subtle dance of swordplay I had spent years mastering.
en_results_raw: the balance was off, throwing me completely out of sync with the subtle dance of swordplay I had spent years mastering. I had tried every type of blade in the armory, from the slender rapiers to the sturdy broadswords, but none of them felt like an extension of myself, like the sword I had lost in the battle. It was as if I was trying to wield a foreign object, one that refused to respond to my every command. The frustration was starting to get to me, and I could feel my patience wearing thin. I needed to find the right blade, and fast, or risk being left behind by my comrades.

en_results_raw: Some of the guys were laughing and joking around, but I just grabbed a cold water and stepped away from the group, searching for a patch of shade to collapse in. The sun was beating down relentlessly, and I could feel the heat radiating off the blacktop. I took a long swig of the icy water, feeling it trickle down my parched throat, and closed my eyes, trying to catch my breath. The sound of the others' chatter and the occasional burst of laughter created a distant hum, but I tuned it out, focusing on the coolness spreading through my chest. For a moment, I just stood there, savoring the brief respite from the sweltering heat and the grueling practice session.

La caja estaba llena de juguetes, pelotas de goma, trompos, y otros objetos de plástico de colores llamativos. De repente, un niño pequeño se acercó a la caja y comenzó a revolver entre los juguetes, sacando un trompo de colores que comenzó a hacer girar con habilidad. El dueño del camión sonrió y le dio una palmada en la espalda al niño, diciéndole que era un verdadero artista. El ambiente se relajó un poco, y pronto todos estábamos riendo y charlando mientras disfrutábamos de nuestros refrescos y observábamos al niño hacer malabarismos con el trompo.

I shifted uncomfortably, my hand on the hilt of my sword, trying to see what she saw, but there was nothing. The fireflies danced around us, their soft glow casting eerie shadows on the ground. Suddenly, Annabeth's head snapped towards a thick clump of bushes, and she motioned for me to follow her. We crept forward, our footsteps quiet on the damp earth, and as we got closer, I could have sworn I heard a faint rustling in the underbrush.

De repente, escuché un ruido detrás de mí y me di la vuelta, listo para defenderme, pero no vi nada. El ruido se repitió, esta vez más fuerte, y supe que no estaba solo en el bosque. en_first_half: Even Clarisse kept her distance, though her venomous looks made it clear she wanted to kill me for breaking her magic
en_second_half: spear. I wished she would just yell or punch me or something. I’d rather get into fights every day than be ignored.
en_results: spell, and I couldn't blame her, really - I had, after all, foiled her plan to turn the entire school into mindless,
en_results_raw: spell, and I couldn't blame her, really - I had, after all, foiled her plan to turn the entire school into mindless, obedient drones, and she was probably itching for revenge. But for now, she seemed content to simply glare at me, her eyes flashing with malevolent intent as she whispered something under her breath that sounded suspiciously like a curse. I shivered, despite myself, and wondered what other tricks she had up her sleeve. Meanwhile, the rest of the class was staring at me in a mixture of awe and fear, and I realized that my little stunt had probably just earned me a whole lot of unwanted attention. As the days went by, whispers of a dark family secret began to circulate, and the truth about their disappearance remained shrouded in mystery. The locals, who had grown accustomed to the quiet rhythms of their coastal town, were shocked and intrigued by the sudden turn of events. Some said they saw the mother and son arguing on the beach, their voices carried away by the wind, while others claimed to have seen a stranger lurking in the shadows. Theories abounded, but one thing was certain: the idyllic facade of Montauk had been shattered, revealing a complex web of secrets and lies that would take months to unravel.

Afortunadamente, no hubo víctimas mortales, pero varios pasajeros resultaron heridos y fueron trasladados al hospital más cercano para recibir atención médica. El incidente causó un gran revuelo en la comunidad y se inició una investigación para determinar las causas del rayo y su impacto en el autobús.

en_first_half: “It’s a terrible story,” Aunty Em said. “Not one for children, really. You see, Annabeth, a bad woman was jealous of me, long ago, when I was young. I had a… a boyfriend, you know, and this bad woman was determined to
en_second_half: break us apart. She caused a terrible accident. My sisters stayed by me. They shared my bad fortune as long as they could, but eventually they passed on. They faded away. I alone have survived, but at a price. Such a price.”
en_results: destroy our relationship and claim him for herself. She was cunning and manipulative, using every trick in the book to turn him against me. I tried to ignore her, to rise above her petty schemes, but she was relentless. She spread
en_results_raw: destroy our relationship and claim him for herself. She was cunning and manipulative, using every trick in the book to turn him against me. I tried to ignore her, to rise above her petty schemes, but she was relentless. She spread rumors and lies about me, trying to tarnish my reputation and make me look bad in his eyes. It was a difficult time, and I was young and naive, unsure of how to deal with such malice. But I refused to give up, and in the end, her plan backfired, and she was left looking foolish. Still, the experience left a scar, and I've always been wary of people with jealous hearts. That's why I want to warn you, Annabeth, to be careful of those who may be envious of your gifts and your spirit. Don't let them bring you down, dear one.

en_results_raw: stranded in the middle of nowhere, for making us fight for our lives against monsters and demigods alike, and for putting us through this never-ending cycle of danger and uncertainty. I was angry with myself, too, for not being able to protect my friends better, for not being able to control my own destiny. The frustration and helplessness were building up inside me like a storm, and I didn't know how much longer I could keep it all bottled up. As I walked, the trees seemed to close in around me, their branches tangling together like skeletal fingers, and I felt like I was being herded towards some unknown fate, with no escape in sight. The air was thick with an eerie, unnatural silence, and I could feel the weight of the gods' attention upon me, their eyes watching and waiting to see what I would do next.

en_results_raw: wasn't just a product of my fevered imagination, but a real, tangible presence that seemed to emanate from the very walls of the ancient castle. I spun around, my eyes scanning the dimly lit hallway, but there was no one in sight. The voice seemed to be coming from all around me, echoing off the stone floor and walls. I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that I was being summoned, called to fulfill some unknown destiny. The voice seemed to be drawing me deeper into the castle, toward some unknown fate. I took a deep breath, my heart pounding in my chest, and began to move forward, the sound of my footsteps echoing through the hallway. As I walked, the voice grew louder, more insistent, until I could feel its words burning in my mind: Percy, take the sword. Your father believes in you. I knew then that I had to find that sword, no matter what dangers lay ahead.

Me sentí listo para enfrentar lo que fuera que se avecinara, con mi madre a mi lado y la espada en la mano.

en_second_half: the very least, the mortal police would be arriving, trying to figure out who had blown a hole in the Arch. If they found me, they’d have some questions.
en_results: least, that's what I told myself as I turned to make my way back through the dark, icy water. My heart was still racing from the encounter, and I could feel
en_results_raw: least, that's what I told myself as I turned to make my way back through the dark, icy water. My heart was still racing from the encounter, and I could feel the weight of the sword dragging me down, but I pressed on, determined to put as much distance between myself and the monster as possible. The water was numbing, but I could feel the cuts and bruises starting to throb, and I knew I needed to find shelter and tend to my wounds soon. I thought of the small cave I had spotted earlier, partially hidden by the rocks and the tangled seaweed, and I made my way towards it, my eyes scanning the surrounding area for any sign of movement. As I reached the cave, I pulled myself out of the water and collapsed onto the dry sand, exhausted, but relieved to have made it out alive. For a moment, I just lay there, catching my breath and trying to process what had just happened. Then, I slowly sat up, and began to examine my injuries, wincing as I touched the tender spots. I needed to start a fire, and find some way to clean and dress my wounds, but for now, I just sat there, trying to calm my racing thoughts, and wondering what other dangers lay ahead.

I followed her gaze, but saw nothing but the endless expanse of water and the faint outline of trees on the horizon.

en_first_half: “There you have it, America.” Barbara Walters turned to the camera. “A man torn apart. An adolescent boy with serious
en_second_half: issues. Let me show you, again, the last known photo of this troubled young fugitive, taken a week ago in Denver.”
en_results: emotional and psychological issues, struggling to find his place in the world, and a grown man with a penchant for
en_results_raw: emotional and psychological issues, struggling to find his place in the world, and a grown man with a penchant for violence and a history of destructive behavior. The contrast is striking, and it raises important questions about the nature of identity, morality, and the human condition. As we delve deeper into the complexities of this individual's story, we are forced to confront the darker aspects of our own society and the ways in which we contribute to the creation of such troubled souls. The journey ahead will be difficult, but it is one that we must undertake if we hope to gain a deeper understanding of the human experience.

vi_results_raw: ra một vụ thảm sát kinh hoàng đến thế. Cô gái 17 tuổi này đã bắn chết cha mẹ và em trai mình, và bây giờ cô đang đối mặt với bản án tù chung thân. Câu chuyện của cô là một lời nhắc nhở về sự tàn phá mà bạo lực có thể gây ra, và về sự cần thiết phải tìm hiểu nguyên nhân sâu xa của những hành động như vậy. Chúng ta cần phải đặt câu hỏi: Liệu có những dấu hiệu cảnh báo nào mà chúng ta đã bỏ qua? Liệu có những cách nào để chúng ta có thể ngăn chặn thảm kịch này? Và bây giờ, chúng ta cần phải đối mặt với thực tế rằng một cuộc đời trẻ tuổi đã bị phá hủy, và nhiều cuộc đời khác đã bị ảnh hưởng bởi hành động của cô.

Ông ta quyết định sẽ phải điều tra thêm về vấn đề này, vì nó có thể ảnh hưởng đến sự cân bằng của thế giới dưới lòng đất.
es_first_half: Hades levantó una ceja. Cuando se inclinó hacia delante, en los pliegues de su túnica aparecieron rostros en sombra, rostros atormentados, como si la prenda estuviera hecha de almas atrapadas en los Campos de Castigo que intentaran escapar.
es_second_half: La parte de mí afectada por el THDA se preguntó, distraída, si el resto de su ropa estaría hecho del mismo modo. ¿Qué cosas horribles había que hacer en la vida para acabar convertido en ropa interior de Hades?
es_results: La luz de la antorcha parpadeó y los rostros desaparecieron, pero Hades no pareció notarlo. Sus ojos, como dos pozos de oscuridad, se clavaron en mí, y sentí que mi alma se estremecía bajo su mirada. "¿Qué es lo
es_results_raw: La luz de la antorcha parpadeó y los rostros desaparecieron, pero Hades no pareció notarlo. Sus ojos, como dos pozos de oscuridad, se clavaron en mí, y sentí que mi alma se estremecía bajo su mirada. "¿Qué es lo que deseas, mortal?", preguntó con una voz que parecía provenir de las profundidades del inframundo. Su tono era neutro, pero pude percibir una ligera curiosidad detrás de sus palabras. Me aclaré la garganta antes de responder, intentando calmar el temblor que se había apoderado de mi voz. "He venido a pedirte un favor, señor del inframundo", dije, tratando de sonar lo más respetuoso posible. Hades se reclinó en su trono, su expresión inescrutable. "Habla", ordenó, y yo comencé a explicar mi petición, esperando que no me condenara a un destino peor que la muerte.
tr_first_half: Hades bir kaşını havaya kaldırdı. Tahtta böyle öne doğru çıkmış otururken siyah cüppesinin kumaşında acı içerisinde kıvranan yüzler beliriyordu; sanki cüppesi Ceza Tarlaları'ndan kaçmaya çalışan ölülerin

The crazy man had caused the explosion in the St. Louis Arch. After all, no kid could’ve done that. A concerned waitress in Denver had seen the man threatening his abductees
en_second_half: outside her diner, gotten a friend to take a photo, and notified the police. Finally, brave Percy Jackson (I was beginning to like this kid) had stolen a gun from his captor in Los Angeles and battled him shotgun-to-rifle on the beach. Police had arrived just in time. I watched, fascinated, as he disemboweled the whole row of dummies, hacking off limbs and basically reducing them to a pile of straw and armor.

As I approached, he caught sight of me and froze, his chest heaving with exertion. For a moment, we just stared at each other, the only sound the creaking of the old wooden dummies.
